title: [Large-Scale] Pediatric Asthma Self-Management Education: Therapeutic Education (TE)-Based Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: No prior experience with basic medical knowledge or educational tool utilization
context.additional_context: A program to enhance pediatric asthma patient education competencies for graduate students in language fields. Requires designing activities implementable in a limited technological environment centered on smartphones

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts of pediatric asthma self-management: symptom recognition, medication administration, and avoidance of triggers.
Learners can design a 10-minute pediatric education scenario using instructional materials based on the ADDIE model.
Learners can produce educational videos or infographics compatible with smartphones through project-based assessment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
